tit.cmt: 本因坊は名字ではないので大文字表記していません

sen.j: 本因坊 秀甫（ほんいんぼう しゅうほ、天保9年（1838年） - 明治19年（1886年）10月14日）は江戸時代から明治にかけての囲碁棋士_(囲碁)。
sen.e: Honinbo Shuho (1838 - October 14, 1886) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory, also called Go) player active from the Edo to the Meiji period.
Honinbo Shuho (1838 - October 14, 1886) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory, also called Go) player from the Edo to the Meiji period.
Honinbo Shuho (1838 - October 14, 1886) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory, also called Go) player from the Edo to the Meiji period.

sen.j: 本名は村瀬秀甫（むらせしゅうほ）。
sen.e: His real name was Shuho MURASE.
His real name was Shuho MURASE.
His real name was Shuho MURASE.

sen.j: 生国は江戸。
sen.e: Born in Edo.
Born in Edo.
Born in Edo.

sen.j: 本因坊丈策、本因坊秀和門下、八段準名人、十八世本因坊。
sen.e: Also known as Disciples of Honinbo Josaku and Honinbo Shuwa, 8-dan Jun Meijin (the title next to Meijin in the Edo period) and the 18th Honinbo.
Also known as a disciple of Honinbo Josaku and Honinbo Shuwa, 8-dan Jun Meijin (the title next to Meijin in the Edo period) and the 18th Honinbo.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。Disciples→a disciple と修正しました。
sen.e: Also known as a disciple of Honinbo Josaku and Honinbo Shuwa, 8-dan Jun Meijin (the title next to Meijin in the Edo period) and the 18th Honinbo.

sen.j: 法名は日寿。
sen.e: His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name given to a person who died or has entered the priesthood) was Nichiju.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name given to a person who died or has entered the priesthood) was Nichiju.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name given to a person who died or has entered the priesthood) was Nichiju.

sen.j: 奔放な棋風で知られる。
sen.e: Shuho was known with his free-wheeling playing style of Igo.
Shuho was known with his free-wheeling playing style of Igo.
Shuho was known with his free-wheeling playing style of Igo.

sen.j: 江戸幕府の庇護がなくなった明治期に囲碁結社方円社を主宰して囲碁界を支え、さらに西欧にまで広める端緒をつくった。
sen.e: He founded Hoensha, an Igo organization, and supported the Igo world in the Meiji period which had lost patronage from the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and made the first step to spread and popularize Igo in the Western world.

He founded Hoensha, an Igo organization, and supported the Igo world in the Meiji period which had lost patronage from the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and made the first step to spread and popularize Igo in Western Europe.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。the Western world→Western Europe と修正しました。
sen.e: He founded Hoensha, an Igo organization, and supported the Igo world in the Meiji period which had lost patronage from the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and made the first step to spread and popularize Igo in Western Europe.

sen.j: 著書に『方円新法』など。
sen.e: His literary works included "Hoen Shinpo".
His literary works included "Hoen Shinpo."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: His literary works included "Hoen Shinpo."

sen.j: 2007年に囲碁殿堂入り。
sen.e: Shuho entered the Igo Hall of Fame in 2007.
Shuho entered the Igo Hall of Fame in 2007.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: Shuho entered the Igo Hall of Fame in 2007.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography

sen.j: 坊門時代
sen.e: As a disciple of the Honinbo
As a disciple of the Honinbo
As a disciple of the Honinbo

sen.j: 江戸の上野車坂下の、本因坊道場の隣家の貧しい大工の家に生まれる。
sen.e: Shuho was born to a poor carpentor's family, next to the Honinbo dojo (training hall) in Ueno Kurumazakashita in Edo.
Shuho was born to a poor carpenter's family, next to the Honinbo dojo (training hall) in Ueno Kurumazakashita in Edo.
Shuho was born to a poor carpenter's family, next to the Honinbo dojo (training hall) in Ueno Kurumazakashita in Edo.

sen.j: 幼名彌吉。
sen.e: His childhood name was Yakichi.
His childhood name was Yakichi.
His childhood name was Yakichi.

sen.j: 弘化3年(1846年)8歳で本因坊丈策に入門。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Honinbo Josaku when he was 8 years old in 1846.
He became a disciple of Honinbo Josaku when he was eight years old in 1846.
He became a disciple of Honinbo Josaku when he was eight years old in 1846.

sen.j: 前述の家庭事情もあり、謝礼金を払えないこともあったという。
sen.e: It is said that he sometimes could not pay the tuition due to the above-mentioned family situation.
It is said that he sometimes could not pay the tuition due to the above-mentioned family situation.
It is said that he sometimes could not pay the tuition due to the above-mentioned family situation.

sen.j: そのためか内弟子になってからは家事万端よく働き、朝は一番に起きて夜は遅くまで碁の勉強に励んだという。
sen.e: Probably due to such situation, he allegedly worked so hard and did any household tasks since he became an uchideshi (disciple boarding in the home of his master), waking up earlier than anybody else and staying up late at night to study Go.
sen.cmt: 内弟子→uchideshi (disciple boarding in the home of his master)http://ejje.weblio.jp/content/%E5%86%85%E5%BC%9F%E5%AD%90
sen.e: Probably due to such situation, he allegedly worked so hard and did any household tasks since he became an uchideshi (disciple boarding in the home of his master), waking up earlier than anybody else and staying up late at night to study Go.

Probably due to such situation, he allegedly worked so hard and did any household tasks since he became an uchideshi (disciple boarding in the home of his master), waking up earlier than anybody else and staying up late at night to study Go.

sen.j: 11歳で初段。
sen.e: He became 11-dan at the age of 11 years old.
He became 1st-dan at the age of 11.
sen.cmt: 11-dan→1st-dan と修正しました。years old を削除しました。
sen.e: He became 1st-dan at the age of 11.

sen.j: 14歳の時に内弟子となる。
sen.e: He became an uchideshi at the age of 14 years old.
He became an uchideshi at the age of 14.
sen.cmt: years old を削除しました。
sen.e: He became an uchideshi at the age of 14.

sen.j: 嘉永7年(1854年)17歳で四段となり、この年に本因坊塾頭の岸本左一郎帰郷により、代わって塾頭を勤める。
sen.e: When Shuho was 17 years old in 1854, he became 4-dan and served as jukuto (school manager) to take over Saichiro KISHIMOTO as he returned to his hometown.
When Shuho was 17 years old in 1854, he became 4-dan and served as jukuto (school manager) to take over Saichiro KISHIMOTO as he returned to his hometown.
When Shuho was 17 years old in 1854, he became 4-dan and served as jukuto (school manager) to take over Saichiro KISHIMOTO as he returned to his hometown.

sen.j: 安政2年、秀和の美濃国、京都、大阪府への旅行に随伴し、五段格を与えられる。
sen.e: In 1855, he accompanied Shuwa on the trip to the Mino Province, Kyoto and Osaka Prefecture and was given the rank equivalent to 5-dan.
In 1855, he accompanied Shuwa on the trip to Mino Province, Kyoto and Osaka Prefecture and was given the rank equivalent to 5-dan.
In 1855, he accompanied Shuwa on the trip to Mino Province, Kyoto and Osaka Prefecture and was given the rank equivalent to 5-dan.

sen.j: 万延元年(1860年)村瀬秀甫と改名。
sen.e: In 1860 he changed his name to Shuho MURASE.
In 1860 he changed his name to Shuho MURASE.
In 1860 he changed his name to Shuho MURASE.

sen.j: 文久元年(1861年)六段、剃髪して御城碁に備えるが、翌年から御城碁は行われなくなり、出仕する機会を得なかった。
sen.e: In 1861 he became 6-dan and took the tonsure to prepare himself for participating in the oshirogo (castle game of Go), but he never had a chance to do so because the oshirogo was suspended in the following year and afterwards.

In 1861 he became 6-dan and took the tonsure to prepare himself for participating in the oshirogo (castle game of Go), but he never had a chance to do so because the oshirogo was discontinued from the following year.
sen.cmt: suspended in the following year and afterwards→discontinued from the following year と修正しました。他の段数と合わせ、6-dan はスペルアウトせずにそのままにしてあります。
sen.e: In 1861 he became 6-dan and took the tonsure to prepare himself for participating in the oshirogo (castle game of Go), but he never had a chance to do so because the oshirogo was discontinued from the following year.

sen.j: 兄弟子である本因坊秀策と十番碁を打ち（先）、6勝3敗1ジゴとする。
sen.e: He played a jubango (10-game match of Go) with Honinbo Shusaku, his anideshi (senior disciple) on Sen (playing first as a handicap), and he won 6 games, lost 3 games and tied 1 game.
sen.cmt: 十番碁→jubango (10 games of Go) http://senseis.xmp.net/?Jubango
sen.e: He played a jubango (10-game match of Go) against Honinbo Shusaku, his anideshi (senior disciple) on Sen (playing first as a handicap), and he won 6 games, lost 3 games and tied 1 game.
sen.cmt: with→against と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。なお、数については「用語統一、その他・31項」に従っております。
sen.e: He played a jubango (10-game match of Go) against Honinbo Shusaku, his anideshi (senior disciple) on Sen (playing first as a handicap), and he won 6 games, lost 3 games and tied 1 game.

sen.j: この頃、秀策と秀甫は坊門の竜虎、碁界の圭玉と称された。
sen.e: Around this time Shusaku and Shuho were called Dragon and Tiger of the Hoinbo Disciples or the Treasure of the Go world
Around this time Shusaku and Shuho were called Dragon and Tiger of the Hoinbo Disciples or the Treasure of the Go world.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: Around this time Shusaku and Shuho were called Dragon and Tiger of the Hoinbo Disciples or the Treasure of the Go world.

sen.j: 文久2年に秀策が死去し、門下実力第一の秀甫が後継と見られていたが、文久3年に本因坊丈和未亡人・勢子の抗議により秀和の長男で14歳の本因坊秀悦が跡目とされる。
sen.e: When Shusaku died in 1862, most people thought that Shuho would succeed him because he was the strongest among the Hoinbo disciples, but the widow of Honinbo Jowa, Seiko, strongly objected it and 14-year-old Honinbo Shuetsu, Shuwa's first son, became an heir in 1863.
sen.cmt: 勢子→Seiko確実なソースは確認できませんでした。
sen.e: When Shusaku died in 1862, most people thought that Shuho would succeed him because he was the best among the Hoinbo disciples, but the widow of Honinbo Jowa, Seiko, strongly objected it and 14-year-old Honinbo Shuetsu, Shuwa's first son, became the heir in 1863.
sen.cmt: strongest→best,an heir→the heir と修正しました。
sen.e: When Shusaku died in 1862, most people thought that Shuho would succeed him because he was the best among the Hoinbo disciples, but the widow of Honinbo Jowa, Seiko, strongly objected it and 14-year-old Honinbo Shuetsu, Shuwa's first son, became the heir in 1863.

sen.j: この年に吉田半十郎と十番碁がある（半十郎二子）。
sen.e: In this year he played a jubango with Hanjuro YOSHIDA (on 2-stone handicap for Hanjuro).
In this year he played a jubango against Hanjuro YOSHIDA (on two-stone handicap for Hanjuro).
sen.cmt: with→against,2-stone→two-stone と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: In this year he played a jubango against Hanjuro YOSHIDA (on two-stone handicap for Hanjuro).

sen.j: 元治元年(1864年)に井上松本因碩と争碁で3連勝し、七段昇段。
sen.e: In 1864 he played a sogo (official challenge match) with Matsumoto Inseki INOUE, finishing in his 3 consecutive wins and he was promoted to 7-dan.
In 1864 he played a sogo (official challenge match) with Matsumoto Inseki INOUE, finishing in his three consecutive wins and he was promoted to 7-dan.
sen.cmt: with→against, 3→three と修正しました。他の段数と合わせ、6-dan はスペルアウトせずにそのままにしてあります。
sen.e: In 1864 he played a sogo (official challenge match) with Matsumoto Inseki INOUE, finishing in his three consecutive wins and he was promoted to 7-dan.

sen.j: 御城碁への参加資格を得るが、この年から幕末動乱のため御城碁は中止となった。
sen.e: Shuho became eligible for the entry to the oshirogo that was terminated due to the upheaval at the end of the Edo period.
Shuho became eligible for the entry to the oshirogo; however, it was called off due to the upheaval at the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: パンクチュエーションを修正しました。terminated→called off と修正しました。
sen.e: Shuho became eligible for the entry to the oshirogo; however, it was called off due to the upheaval at the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 跡目の道を絶たれ、望みを失くした秀甫は越後国方面に遊歴に出て、江戸には不在であることが多くなった。
sen.e: He lost a hope for future as his succession of the Honinbo was denied and wondered around the Echigo Province and neighboring regions, often being away from Edo.
He lost a hope for the future, as his succession of the Honinbo was denied; wondered around the Echigo Province and neighboring regions, thus often being away from Edo.
sen.cmt: the, カンマ、thus を補いました。パンクチュエーションを修正しました。
sen.e: He lost a hope for the future, as his succession of the Honinbo was denied; wondered around the Echigo Province and neighboring regions, thus often being away from Edo.

sen.j: その中で慶応4年(1868年)には秀和との手合を先相先に進める。
sen.e: Under such circumstance he advanced to play with Shuwa on Sen ai sen (playing black then white then black) in 1868.
Under such circumstance he advanced to play against Shuwa on Sen ai sen (playing black then white then black) in 1868.
Under such circumstance he advanced to play against Shuwa on Sen ai sen (playing black then white then black) in 1868.

sen.j: 明治4年(1871年)帰京して秀和と先相先で8局対局し、秀甫の5勝3敗となる。
sen.e: In 1871 he returned to Edo and played 8 games with Shuwa, resulting in Shuho's 5 wins and 3 losses.
In 1871 he returned to Edo and played eight games on Sen ai sen against Shuwa, resulting in Shuho's five wins and three losses.
sen.cmt: 「先相先で」を補いました。with→against,8→eight,5→five,3→three と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1871 he returned to Edo and played eight games on Sen ai sen against Shuwa, resulting in Shuho's five wins and three losses.

sen.j: 10月に秀和に従い名古屋に赴く。
sen.e: Shuho accompanied Shuwa to go to Nagoya in October.
Shuho accompanied Shuwa to go to Nagoya in October.
Shuho accompanied Shuwa to go to Nagoya in October.

sen.j: 明治5年、本因坊秀栄とともに美濃国、尾張国、伊勢国、大阪を遊歴する。
sen.e: In 1872 he, together with Honinbo Shuei, went to the Mino, Owari and Ise Provinces and Osaka.
In 1872 he, together with Honinbo Shuei, traveled Mino, Owari and Ise Provinces and Osaka.
sen.cmt: went to the→traveled と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1872 he, together with Honinbo Shuei, traveled Mino, Owari and Ise Provinces and Osaka.

sen.j: 秀和は明治6年に没し、秀悦が15世本因坊を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1873 Shuwa died and Shuetsu succeed the 15th Honinbo.
In 1873 Shuwa died and Shuetsu succeed the 15th Honinbo.
In 1873 Shuwa died and Shuetsu succeed the 15th Honinbo.

sen.j: 方円社時代
sen.e: In the time of Hoensha
In the time of Hoensha
In the time of Hoensha

sen.j: 明治12年(1879年)、中川亀三郎が本因坊秀悦、安井算英、井上因碩、林秀栄らとともに研究会方円社発足を計画し、秀甫はその要請に従って越後より帰京してこれに参加、社長となる。
sen.e: In 1879 Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA planned to launch a study group named Hoensha, together with Honinbo Shuetsu, Sanei YASUI, Inseki INOUE and Shuei HAYASHI among others, so Shuho accepted their request and returned from Echigo to join them and he became President.

In 1879 Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA planned to launch a study group named Hoensha, together with Honinbo Shuetsu, Sanei YASUI, Inseki INOUE and Shuei HAYASHI among others, so Shuho accepted their request and returned from Echigo to join them and he became the president.
sen.cmt: President→the president と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1879 Kamesaburo NAKAGAWA planned to launch a study group named Hoensha, together with Honinbo Shuetsu, Sanei YASUI, Inseki INOUE and Shuei HAYASHI among others, so Shuho accepted their request and returned from Echigo to join them and he became the president.

sen.j: 方円社が毎月発行した「囲棋新報」に掲載される棋譜には秀甫の評が付けられた。
sen.e: Shuho's reviews on the kifu (Go game record) appeared on "Igo Shinpo" published by Hoensha every month.
Shuho's reviews on the kifu (Go game record) appeared on 'Igo Shinpo' published by Hoensha every month.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。
sen.e: Shuho's reviews on the kifu (Go game record) appeared on 'Igo Shinpo' published by Hoensha every month.

sen.j: 方円社では各家元が脱退して独自の免状を発行するようになり、明治13年に段位制から級位制に移行していた。
sen.e: After the Iemoto (the head family of Go school) had withdrawn from Hoensha, Hoensha started to issue its original menjo (diploma) and changed from dan-i ranking system to kyu-i ranking system in 1880.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the each Iemoto (the head family of Go school) had withdrawn from Hoensha, Hoensha started to issue its original menjo (diploma) and changed from dan-i ranking system to kyu-i ranking system in 1880.

After the each Iemoto (the head family of Go school) had withdrawn from Hoensha, Hoensha started to issue its original menjo (diploma) and changed from dan-i ranking system to kyu-i ranking system in 1880.

sen.j: この時期秀甫は他の棋士を先以下に打ち込んでおり、明治14年に方円社全員の推薦により2級（八段）へ進んだ。
sen.e: Around that time Shuho beat other kishi (professional Go players) down to Sen or further handicaps and advanced to 2-kyu (8-dan) with the recommendation by all members of Hoensha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Around that time Shuho had beaten other kishi (professional Go players) down to Sen or further handicaps and advanced to 2-kyu (8-dan) with the recommendation by all members of Hoensha.
sen.cmt: beat→had beaten と修正しました。これらの級数、段数は他の段数と合わせ、スペルアウトせずにそのままにしてあります。
sen.e: Around that time Shuho had beaten other kishi (professional Go players) down to Sen or further handicaps and advanced to 2-kyu (8-dan) with the recommendation by all members of Hoensha.

sen.j: その後には水谷縫次がただ一人秀甫に先相先に進むが、明治17年に夭逝した。
sen.e: Afterwards only Nuiji MIZUTANI proceeded to play with Shuho on Sen ai sen but died young in 1884.
After that, only Nuiji MIZUTANI proceeded to play against Shuho on Sen ai sen, but died young in 1884.
sen.cmt: Afterwards→After that,with→against と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: After that, only Nuiji MIZUTANI proceeded to play against Shuho on Sen ai sen, but died young in 1884.

sen.j: またドイツ人の鉄道技師オスカー・コルセルトに碁の指南をして西洋へ碁を広めるきっかけを作った。
sen.e: Shuho taught Go to a German railroad engineer, Oskar Korschelt, which became the beginning to spread and popularize Go in the West.
sen.cmt: オスカー・コルセルト→Oskar Korschelthttp://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:JlomUj0ZDoEJ:www.amazon.co.jp/Theory-Practice-Go-O-Korschelt/dp/0804805725+Oskar+Korschelt%E3%80%80Go&cd=3&hl=ja&ct=clnk&gl=jp
sen.e: Shuho taught Go to a German railroad engineer, Oskar KORSCHELT, which became the beginning of the popularization of Go in the West.
sen.cmt: Korschelt→KORSCHELT,to spread and popularize→of the popularization of と修正しました。
sen.e: Shuho taught Go to a German railroad engineer, Oskar KORSCHELT, which became the beginning of the popularization of Go in the West.

sen.j: 明治15年に著書『方円新法』を方円社にて発行。
sen.e: He released a book titled "Hoen Shinpo" published by Hoensha in 1882.
He released a book titled "Hoen Shinpo" published by Hoensha in 1882.
He released a book titled "Hoen Shinpo" published by Hoensha in 1882.

sen.j: 明治17年から五段の本因坊秀栄と十番碁を開始（秀栄先）。
sen.e: Since 1884 he started to play a jubango with 5-dan Honinbo Shuei (with Shuei at sen).
Since 1884 he started to play a jubango with 5-dan Honinbo Shuei (with Shuei at sen).
Since 1884 he started to play a jubango with 5-dan Honinbo Shuei (with Shuei at sen).

sen.j: 明治19年に秀栄は秀甫の八段を正式に認めて、同時に本因坊を秀甫に譲り、秀甫は18世本因坊秀甫となる。
sen.e: In 1886, Shuei officially acknowledged Shuho being 8-dan at the same time he stepped aside to make him to the Honinbo, thus Shuho became the 18th Honinbo Shuho.
In 1886, Shuei officially approved Shuho being 8-dan at the same time he stepped aside to make him to the Honinbo, thus Shuho became the 18th Honinbo Shuho.
In 1886, Shuei officially approved Shuho being 8-dan at the same time he stepped aside to make him to the Honinbo, thus Shuho became the 18th Honinbo Shuho.

sen.j: また秀甫は秀栄に七段を贈った。
sen.e: Then Shuho awarded Shuei 7-dan.
Then Shuho gave Shuei 7-dan.
Then Shuho gave Shuei 7-dan.

sen.j: 秀栄との十番碁は8月6日に最終局を打って5勝5敗の打ち分けた。
sen.e: The jubango with Shuei ended with the last game on August 6, finishing with a 5-5 tie.
The jubango against Shuei ended with the last game on August 6, finishing as a five-five tie.
The jubango against Shuei ended with the last game on August 6, finishing as a five-five tie.

sen.j: この最終局が秀甫の絶局となり、10月14日没する。
sen.e: This game was his last game and Shuho died on October 14.
This game was his last game and Shuho died on October 14.
This game was his last game and Shuho died on October 14.

sen.j: 評価
sen.e: Reputation
Reputation

sen.j: 秀甫は中江兆民『一年有半』で「近代非凡人三十一人」に数えられるほどの名声を得ていたが、本因坊道策・秀和・秀策・秀栄といった史上の大名人たちに比べると知名度は低く、時の第一人者でありながらその生涯は決して恵まれたものではなかった。
sen.e: Though Shuho had such an excellent reputation that Chomin NAKAE regarded him as "one of the 31 distinguished people in the modern time" in his book "Ichinen Yuhan" (One and a Half Year Left), he was less known to the public, compared with the grand masters such as Honinbo Dosaku, Shuwa, Shusaku and Shuei, and he did not always live a privileged life in spite that he was the strongest player of the time.

Although Shuho had such an excellent reputation that Chomin NAKAE regarded him as 'one of the 31 distinguished people in the modern time' in his book "Ichinen Yuhan" (One and a Half Year Left), he was less known to the public, compared with the grand masters such as Honinbo Dosaku, Shuwa, Shusaku and Shuei, and his life was not totally fortunate in spite of that he was the leading player of the time.
sen.cmt: Though→Although,クォーツを修正しました。he did not always live a privileged life→his life was not totally fortunate,strongest→leading と修正しました。of を補いました。
sen.e: Although Shuho had such an excellent reputation that Chomin NAKAE regarded him as 'one of the 31 distinguished people in the modern time' in his book "Ichinen Yuhan" (One and a Half Year Left), he was less known to the public, compared with the grand masters such as Honinbo Dosaku, Shuwa, Shusaku and Shuei, and his life was not totally fortunate in spite of that he was the leading player of the time.

sen.j: しかしよき師とライバルに恵まれ、彼らとの対戦成績も劣ってはいない。
sen.e: However, he was blessed with good teachers and rivals and he scored fairly well with them.
However, he was blessed with good teachers and rivals and he scored fairly well against them.
However, he was blessed with good teachers and rivals and he scored fairly well against them.

sen.j: 師の秀和は「秀策が明治まで長生きしていたとしても、おそらく秀甫に分があっただろう」と極めて高く評価している。
sen.e: His master, Shuwa, gave high praise for him, saying that "Even if Shusaku had lived long enough to the Meiji period, Shuho would probably have had been at advantage over Shusaku".
His master, Shuwa, gave high praise for him, saying that 'Even if Shusaku had lived long enough to the Meiji period, Shuho would probably have had an advantage over Shusaku.'
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。been at→an と修正しました。
sen.e: His master, Shuwa, gave high praise for him, saying that 'Even if Shusaku had lived long enough to the Meiji period, Shuho would probably have had an advantage over Shusaku.'

sen.j: 現代囲碁界でも石田章など、秀甫をこれら大名人の列に連なる実力者と見る者は少なくない。
sen.e: Even in today's Igo World, not a few people including Akira ISHIDA regard Shuho being on par with these grand masters.
Even in today's Igo World, not a few people including Akira ISHIDA regard Shuho being on par with these grand masters.
Even in today's Igo World, not a few people including Akira ISHIDA regard Shuho being on par with these grand masters.
